author: A_Brickset_user
title: This is more like rated 11!
review:
THis is a horribly great game. It covers the whole of Bionicle as we know it. (besides the stupid metru nui stuff)
I luvitt. The only bad parts are that 1. you can't be Lewa the original. or 2. I can't get past the stupid vine part in the jungle withe the rocks by the waterfall!!!!

title: I can't win it!
review:
Cons:

author: BIONICLEGuy
title: I CAN'T BELIEVE THIS WAS IN A CHARITY SHOP............actually, maybe I can.
review:
This is a great game, why would someone dump this?
Actually, now I can imagine why.............Galidor: The Game came packed with it.
This is the third best video game I have played ever on any device, and the best on a PC.
First of all, all the proper Toa are in this game (Yes, I'm looking at you Toa Inika) and, for a 2003 LEGO PC game, the graphics are stunning!
Plus, because this wonder was in a charity shop, I got a great game (and a.....um....not so great game) for only Â£2! Utterly a bargain!
Overall, get this game NOW..........but avoid the Galidor multipack.

author: mindstorms4494
title: Bionicle; a Good Game Overall
review: I bought this game in 2008. It has 8 levels in all. The first level is about Toa Tahu helping the Matoran villagers of Ta-Koro and fighting the Rahi and Bohrok. Level 2 sees Kopaka ice surfing, trying to stop more Bohrok. Level 3 sees Gali NUVA saving Matoran villagers and fighting and defeating all 6 Bohrok-Kal at the same time. :O  Not in a million years! Level 4 sees Pohatu riding in a cart with a Matoran, trying to open the locks to the mine cave door. Level 5 sees Onua Nuva fighting the Lerahk Rahkshi. Level 6 sees Lewa Nuva soaring through Le-Koro and fighting the Pahrak Rahkshi. Level 7 sees Tahu Nuva lava surfing trying to beat the rahkshi to Ta-Koro. Level 8..... sees Takanuva fighting and ultimately defeating Makuta once and for all! Overall, I'd say it was worth the $20.00. It inclues bonus videos unlockable by collecting light stones.
